class.name: ColorRect
class.brief_description: A control that displays a colored rectangle, with or without an outline.
class.description: Displays a rectangle filled with a solid [member color]. See also [ReferenceRect] for an alternative designed for UI debugging. [b]Tip:[/b] By having a [ColorRect] span the entire viewport, it can be used to create 2D post-processing shaders using a shader of type [code]canvas_item[/code] on the node.

members.member: If [code]true[/code], the rectangle's edges and outline are antialiased. [b]Note:[/b] Antialiasing only works if [member line_width] is greater than [code]0[/code].
The rectangle's fill color. Only effective if [member draw_background] is [code]true[/code].
If [code]true[/code], draws the fill color defined in [member color] as the node's background.
If [code]true[/code], draws the line color defined in [member line_color] as the node's outline. The outline is always drawn on top of the background.
The rectangle's outline color. Only effective if [member draw_outline] is [code]true[/code].

The outline's width. If set to a negative value, the outline is always drawn 1 pixel wide and does not scale with viewport zoom. Only effective if [member draw_outline] is [code]true[/code]. [b]Note:[/b] Antialiasing (see [member antialiased]) is only supported with positive line widths.
